title: Crafted XML File Code Execution
author: gL1nt
body_snippet:
It is possible to craft a connection that executes arbitrary PowerShell commands when it is double-clicked. This is problematic because an attacker could export a code-executing connection and then trick someone into importing and clicking on it, allowing the attacker to execute code on their machine. The root of the issue is this piece of code that is used for making PowerShell connections:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29503289/162325436-c75e93dc-7ab3-4e49-b30d-4ccf73dc...

Trying to assess the severity of the vulnerability - please consider the following:

- Privilege escalation is only possible when the configuration file has bad permissions and/or is loaded from a share
- Usually requires manual user interaction (might be circumvented when "reopen last connections" is enabled)
- Requiring a double click on the connection one might consider this as severe as the possibility to double-click a random .batch file containing the malicious code
